title: RX-77-2 "Guncannon"
notes: The first HGUC kit ever released. Includes Spray Missiles.

title: YMS-15 "Gyan"
notes: First 1/144 scale kit to use a detachable clear colored beam effect part for its beam saber.

title: AMX-011S "Zaku III Custom"
AMX-004 "Qubeley"
MSN-00100 "Hyaku-Shiki"
notes: First HGUC kit to use chrome plated parts. Parts runners use "undergating" arrangement, visually reducing the amount of nub marks during assembly. Includes dry transfer sheet with two "百" markings.

title: MSM-07 "Z'Gok"
RX-75 "Guntank"
notes: First HGUC kit to not include stickers

title: MSM-03 "Gogg"
MS-07B "Gouf"
RMS-099 "Rick Dias"
AMX-004-2 "Qubeley Mk-II"
notes: Color variant of HGUC-004.

title: RMS-106 "Hi-Zack"
notes: Later reissues of this kit have the pelvis piece B7 molded with a rectangular hole to accommodate an Action Base 2. Compatible with the "Weapons for Mobile Suit" kit of the 1985 Zeta Gundam Gunpla series.

title: RX-78GP01 "Gundam GP01"
notes: First Gundam released in the HGUC line. Includes non-transformable FF-XII Core Fighter II and 90mm Machine Gun as seen in episodes 2 and 3 of the OVA.

title: AMX-011 "Zaku III"
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-003.

title: AMX-107 "Bawoo"
notes: First transformable/separable mobile suit in the HGUC line.

title: MS-14F "Gelgoog Marine"
MS-09F "Dom Tropen"
RX-78GP01Fb "Gundam GP01Fb"
notes: Parts variant of HGUC-013. Includes non-transformable FF-XII-Fb Core Fighter II Full Burnern.

title: MSM-07S "Z'Gok Commander Type" (Char Aznable custom)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-006.

title: RGM-79 “GM”
RX-78-2 “Gundam”
notes: The first HGUC Gundam to use clear colored beam saber effect parts; this would not be standard on HGUC Gundams until 2005. Includes non-transformable FF-X7 Core Fighter.

title: MSN-02 “Zeong”
notes: First HGUC model to include a display base. Fingers are compatible with MG beam saber effect parts.

title: MSA-0011 “S Gundam”
notes: Not transformable unlike its MG counterpart. Includes non-transformable FXA-08GB G-Core. G-Attacker unit sold separately as EX-05.

title: RMS-141 “Xekueins”
RX-78GP03S “Gundam GP03S”
notes: Features deployable folding arms. Includes non-transformable FF-XII-Sp Core Fighter II-Sp.

title: MS-14Fs “Gelgoog Marine” (Cima Garahau custom)
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-016.

title: MS-09F “Dom Tropen” (Kimberlite Forces colors)
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-017. Includes open left hand, rear skirt thruster, and additional weapons and ammo.

title: RX-78GP03 “Gundam GP03 ‘Dendrobium’”
notes: Enhanced version of HGUC-025. It is the longest at “about 1m*0.5m*0.6m” and most expensive non-bundled HGUC kit.

title: MSA-0011[Ext] “Ex-S Gundam”
notes: Parts variant of HGUC-023. Not transformable unlike its MG counterpart.

title: RX-178 “Gundam Mk-II" (Titans colors)
notes: First kit to have a right hand and beam saber molded as a single piece. Includes marking sheet for units 01-03. Later reissues of this kit have HGUC-053's modified foot parts.

title: AMX-107 “Bawoo" (Mass Production colors)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-015. Fully transformable kit.

title: MS-06S “Zaku II Commander Type” (Char Aznable custom)
notes: First 1/144 scale Zaku II kit to feature a movable monoeye; removal of helmet required to adjust monoeye.

title: RMS-099 “Rick Dias” (Quattro Bajeena custom)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-010.

title: MS-06Fs “Zaku II Type FS” (Garma Zabi custom)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-032. Includes Magella Top Cannon, larger Heat Hawk, and a different head piece with vulcan guns. First HGUC mobile suit in MSV line.

title: FXA-05D/RX-178 “Super Gundam”
notes: Color variant of HGUC-030 with fully transformable FXA-05D G-Defenser. Also the first HGUC kit to introduce Mobile Armors with similar size to the Mobile Suits. Later reissues of this kit have HGUC-053's modified foot parts.

title: PMX-003 The-O
MSM-03C “Hygogg”
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

title: RGM-79D “GM Cold Districts Type”
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket
notes: Last HGUC kit to have a non-functional beam saber handle.

title: MSM-07E “Z'Gok Experiment”
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

title: MS-06F “Zaku II”
notes: Color variant of HGUC-032. Includes two leg-mounted missile pods.

title: MSZ-006 “Zeta Gundam”
notes: First HGUC kit to transform via parts-swapping. Includes grenade launchers and Hyper Mega Launcher with landing gear. Also the last HGUC kit to have a right hand and beam saber molded as a single piece.

title: ORX-005 “Gaplant”
notes: Fully transformable kit. Includes booster unit and display base.

title: MS-09R2 “Rick Dom II”
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

title: RX-77D “Guncannon Mass Production Type”
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

title: MS-14Jg “Gelgoog Jäger”
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket
notes: Released to coincide with the 15th anniversary of Mobile Suit Gundam 0080.

title: RGM-79G “GM Command”
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket
notes: Uses a modified version of the A plate runner of HGUC-038.

title: RX-78NT-1 “Gundam NT1”
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket
notes: Includes removable Chobham Armor parts. The last HGUC Gundam kit to have a single-piece beam saber.

title: Hyaku-Shiki + “Mega Bazooka Launcher”
notes: Enhanced version of HGUC-005; molded in golden yellow instead of original gold chrome plating. Mega Bazooka Launcher is fully transformable with minor parts swapping. Includes custom display base. Works with linkage part of HGUC-061.

title: MRX-009 “Psycho Gundam”
notes: Fully transformable kit. Largest stand-alone HGUC kit to date.

title: “G-Armor” (RX-78-2 “Gundam” + “G-Fighter”)
notes: Enhanced verson of HGUC-021. The Gundam's feet are modified to allow docking with the G-Fighter. Backpack has also been modified to hold the beam sabers more firmly. Includes display base.

title: RGM-79G “GM Command Space”
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-046.

title: RMS-108 “Marasai”
notes: First kit to include a peg in the right weapon hand for extra security.

title: RX-178 Gundam Mk-II + Flyingarmor
notes: Color variant of HGUC-030 with Flying Armor. The Gundam Mk-II's legs are modified like HGUC-50, allowing for greater movement. Includes display base for Flying Armor and mesh pipes for the beam saber holder joints on the backpack. Also the first kit to include a preview of all the previously released kits from that anime series in the instruction manual.

title: NRX-044 Asshimar
notes: Fully transformable kit. Includes "swivel" display base with storage compartment for extra parts and adapter for Mobile Armor mode.

title: RMS-106 Hi-Zack (Earth Federation Force colors)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-012. Includes marking sheet with EFF and Titans symbols. Later reissues of this kit have the pelvis piece B7 molded with a rectangular hole to accommodate an Action Base 2.

title: RX-121-1 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel Custom]
series: Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans
notes: First ever mobile suit to use double-jointed elbow parts previously used in Master Grade kits; this became one of the basic gimmicks of later HGUC models. First release included Advance of Zeta Guide Book. Later reissues had the D plate runner molded in KPS instead of ABS.

title: RX-121-2A Gundam TR-1 [Advanced Hazel]
series: Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-056. Later reissues had the D plate runner molded in KPS instead of ABS.

title: RX-110 Gabthley
notes: Fully transformable kit with three modes, including a "Middle Form". Includes "swivel" display base with storage compartment for extra parts and adapter for Mobile Armor mode.

title: MS-09/MS-09R Dom/Rick Dom
notes: First ever HGUC model to provide spare parts of alternate types. First 1/144 Dom to use a clear visor and adjustable monoeye.

title: PMX-001 Palace Athene
MSA-005 Methuss
notes: Fully transformable kit. Linkage part to HGUC-048 is included.

title: AMX-003 Gaza-C (Haman Karn Custom)
notes: Fully transformable kit. Actual kit colors are not accurate to the anime art, as the parts are molded in pinkish white and maroon instead of the proper lavender and purple.

title: AMX-003 Gaza-C
notes: Color variant of HGUC-062. Fully transformable kit. Includes BA-1 display base.

title: MS-05B Zaku I
EMS-10 Zudah
notes: Features extendable arms. Includes pieces to make three different head configurations (two standard type and one commander type).

title: RX-78GP02A Gundam GP02A
notes: Released to commemorate the 15th anniversary of Mobile Suit Gundam 0083. Uses almost no polycaps on the vital joints (only on the waist, hips, ankles, and accessories). Includes BA-1 display base and adapter for use with HGUC-013 or HGUC-018 to re-enact fight scenes from the OVA.

title: RGM-79 Powered GM
MS-05B Zaku I (Black Tri-Stars Type)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-064.

title: RX-121-2 Gundam TR-1 [Hazel II]
series: Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans
notes: Parts variant of HGUC-057.

title: MS-14S Gelgoog (Char Aznable Custom)
notes: First HGUC kit to incorporate a separate pelvis joint that allows forward and backward hip movement. This feature would later on be used in the HGUC and other HG lines.

title: MS-05L Zaku I Sniper Type
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-064.

title: RGM-79FP GM Striker
notes: Uses the D plate runner of HGUC-067.

title: ORX-005 Gaplant TR-5 ‘Hrairoo’
series: Advance of Zeta: The Flag of Titans
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-042. Fully transformable kit with minor parts-swapping. Includes display base and Shielder Unit attachment part to combine the Long Blade Rifle with HGUC-056/HGUC-057's Shield Boosters or HGUC-069's shield.

title: RGM-79Q GM Quel
notes: Parts variant of HGUC-069. First HGUC kit to include optionally separate front skirt armor, which would become the standard for later kits.

title: RX-78GP02A Gundam GP02A (Type-MLRS)
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-066. Includes optional parts for Beam Bazooka Type configuration.

title: MS-14A Gelgoog / MS-14C Gelgoog Cannon
notes: Color variant of HGUC-070 with additional parts to build either variant, as well as head parts for standard and commander variants.

title: RX-79[G]BD-2 Blue Destiny Unit 2
series: Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: The Blue Destiny
notes: First HGUC Gundam to use the pelvis swing joint first introduced in HGUC-070.

title: MSM-04 Acguy
notes: Includes stub piece to replicate missing right arm in episode 9 of Mobile Suit Gundam: The 08th MS Team.

title: RX-79[G] Gundam Ground Type
series: Mobile Suit Gundam: The 08th MS Team
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-077.

title: RX-79[G]BD-1 Blue Destiny Unit 1
series: Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: The Blue Destiny
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-077.

title: MSM-10 Zock
notes: Includes adapter for Action Base 1.

title: RX-79BD-3 Blue Destiny Unit 3
series: Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story: The Blue Destiny
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-077.

title: MSN-03 Jagd Doga (Gyunei Guss Custom)
notes: Features gunmetal colored joint parts. Includes effect parts for funnels.

title: MSN-03 Jagd Doga (Quess Paraya Custom)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-083 with a different head piece. Beam Assault Rifle replaced with Mega Gatling Gun. Includes effect parts for funnels.

title: RGZ-91 Re-GZ
notes: Features gunmetal colored joint parts. Includes Back Weapon System.

title: RX-93 ν Gundam
notes: Features gunmetal colored joint parts. Includes additional Fin Funnel holder to make the RX-93 ν Gundam Double Fin Funnel Type. Released to coincide with the 20th anniversary of Char's Counterattack.

title: MS-06FZ Zaku II FZ
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket
notes: Includes A-type and B-type heads. Hip joints feature a forward swing mechanism to replicate the crash pose in episode 1 of the OVA.

title: MSN-04 Sazabi
notes: Features gunmetal colored joint parts.

title: MS-18E Kämpfer
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket

title: MS-09RII Rick Dom II (Colony Attack Colors)
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket
notes: Color variant of HGUC-043.

title: AMS-119 Geara Doga
notes: First HG kit to use a switch under the head to rotate the monoeye; this would later on become a standard feature in 1/144 scale Geara Zulu and most Zaku II kits. Features gunmetal colored joint and weapon parts. Includes optional commander type head.

title: AMS-119 Geara Doga (Rezin Schnyder Custom)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-091. Includes beam sword effect part and different beam machine gun.

title: ν Gundam HWS
notes: Re-release of HGUC-086 with additional armor and weapons.

title: RMS-099B Schuzrum Dias
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-010. Includes marking sheet with Zeon, A.E.U.G., and EFSF markings.

title: RX-93-ν2 Hi-ν Gundam
series: Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack - Beltorchika's Children
notes: Design is more closely related to the 2007 MG redesign than the original lineart. Features gunmetal colored joint and weapon parts. Unlike its MG counterparts, only two of its six Fin Funnels are functional.

title: RMS-119 EWAC Zack
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-012. Incorporates HGUC-091's monoeye switch gimmick. Later reissues of this kit have the pelvis piece B7 molded with a rectangular hole to accommodate an Action Base 2.

title: RGM-89 Jegan
FA-78-3 Full Armor Gundam 7th
series: Mobile Suit Gundam: Battlefield Record U.C. 0081
notes: First HGUC Gundam to use the universal hip joint assembly derived from the High Grade Gundam 00 line instead of the conventional ball joint assembly.

title: NZ-666 Kshatriya
notes: First kit to use the current format of the MS name on the bottom of the box cover and the series logos on the front and sides of the box.

title: RX-0 Unicorn Gundam (Destroy Mode)
notes: 100th HGUC release. Includes Beam Magnum.

title: RX-0 Unicorn Gundam (Unicorn Mode)
notes: Uses the A plate runner of HGUC-100. Includes Hyper Bazooka, beam saber effect parts, and a pair of open hands.

title: AMS-129 Geara Zulu
RGZ-95 ReZEL
notes: Transforms via parts-swapping.

title: RGM-89S Stark Jegan
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-097.

title: MS-06F2 Zaku II F2 (Zeon Version)
notes: First HG Zaku II kit to incorporate HGUC-091's monoeye switch gimmick. Includes two leg-mounted missile pods and optional commander and Applique Armor type heads.

title: D-50C Loto (Twin Set)
notes: First HGUC kit to be released as two individual MS units.

title: MS-06F2 Zaku II F2 (E.F.S.F Version)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-105.

notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-103. Transforms via parts-swapping. Released to coincide with episode 1 of the OVA.

notes: First kit to be released from the After War timeline (HGAW).

title: GF13-017NJII G Gundam
notes: First kit to be released from the Future Century timeline (HGFC). Includes transformable Core Lander and clear orange "God Finger" hands.

title: MSZ-010 ΖΖ Gundam
notes: Transforms via parts-swapping. Includes non-transformable FXA-07GB Neo Core Fighter and Action Base adapter for G-Fortress mode that doubles as a spare parts holder.

title: AMS-129 Geara Zulu (Angelo Sauper Use)
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-102.

notes: Uses the C and D plate runners of HGUC-067. Introduces the HG MP-1 E plate runner, which consists of hand parts for later GM and MSA-003 Nemo kits. Includes adapter for Action Base 1.

title: RB-79 Ball Twin Set
notes: Includes two display bases for each Ball.

title: MSN-001A1 Delta Plus
notes: Transforms via parts-swapping.

title: MSN-06S Sinanju
notes: Released to coincide with episode 2 of the OVA.

title: MS-07B-3 Gouf Custom
series: Mobile Suit Gundam: The 08th MS Team
notes: Uses the D1 plate runner of the original HG kit.

title: GX-9900-DV Gundam X Divider
notes: Parts variant of HGAW-109.

title: GF13-050NSW Nobell Gundam
notes: Uses no polycaps. Includes Beam Ribbons with bottom weight, a clear white BA-1 display base with adapter, and hands for HGFC-110 to replicate a scene from episode 30 of the series.

title: RGM-79N GM Custom
notes: Uses the D plate runner of HGUC-067 and the MP-1 E plate runner of HGUC-113.

notes: First Gundam not to be part of any official timeline. Also the first HG kit to feature non-functional beam saber handles since HGUC-038.

title: AMS-129 Geara Zulu (Guards Type)
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-112. Released to coincide with episode 3 of the OVA.

title: RGM-89De Jegan (ECOAS Type)
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-097. First kit to use runner as storage for unused hand parts.

title: AMX-009 Dreissen (Unicorn Ver.)
notes: Uses runner as storage for unused hand parts. Compatible with effect parts from HGUC-083.

title: RGC-83 GM Cannon II
notes: Uses the B plate runner of HGUC-120, the D plate runner of HGUC-067, and the MP-1 E plate runner of HGUC-113. Uses piece of C plate runner as storage for unused hand parts.

title: GF13-017NJ Shining Gundam
notes: Includes transformable Core Lander, "Super Mode" head, and clear green "Shining Finger" hands, "Giant Hand" and "Shining Finger Sword" effect parts.

title: GF13-001NHII Master Gundam & Fuunsaiki
notes: Includes clear red "Master Cloth", "Darknes Finger" hands, and "Giant Hand" effect parts and display base for Fuunsaiki, plus a clear pink Master Asia figurine. Transforms into Normal Mode via parts-swapping.

title: GF13-050NSW Nobell Gundam Berserker Mode
notes: Red gloss-injected variant of HGFC-119. Beam Ribbons with bottom weight replaced with "hair" piece and beam sword effect parts.

title: RGM-96X Jesta
notes: Uses runner as storage for unused hand parts.

title: RMS-179 GM II

title: AMS-129M Zee Zulu
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-102. Released to coincide with episode 4 of the OVA.

title: MS-21C Dra-C
notes: Includes beam gatling gun from Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn and a clear display base.

title: RX-0 Unicorn Gundam 02 Banshee (Destroy Mode)

title: RX-0 Unicorn Gundam 02 Banshee (Unicorn Mode)

title: MSN-001 Delta Gundam
notes: Parts and gold chrome plated variant of HGUC-115. First gold plated release since HGUC-005. First release from Unicorn MSV. Transforms via parts-swapping.

title: MS-05L Zaku I Sniper Type (Yonem Kirks Custom)
notes: Color variant of HGUC-071 with new head, left shoulder armor, and backpack parts. Some parts require cementing.

title: RMS-108 Marasai (Unicorn Ver.)

title: MSM-04G Juaggu (Unicorn Ver.)
MSA-003 Nemo (Unicorn Ver.)
notes: Uses the MP-1 E plate runner of HGUC-113. Includes GM Custom Rifle.

title: RAS-96 Anksha
notes: Released to coincide with episode 5 of the OVA. Transforms via minor parts-swapping. Includes BA-1 display base with MA mode adapter plus handles and support peg to accommodate most 1/144 scale MS kits in MA mode.

title: RGZ-95C ReZEL Type C [Defenser B-Unit] [GR]
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-103. Transforms via parts-swapping.

title: RMS-192M Zaku Mariner
notes: Molded in Gundam Unicorn colors, despite being marketed as a Gundam ZZ kit. Includes two different antennas, two different chest pieces, and two different pairs of front leg pieces.

title: Base Jabber (Unicorn Ver.)
notes: Support unit for HGUC-130 and most 1/144 scale kits. Holds up to two MS kits with the removal of the propellant tanks.

title: RX-139 Hambrabi
notes: Fully transformable kit. Shares Fedayeen Rifle runner with HGUC-138.

title: RGM-79SP GM Sniper II
series: Mobile Suit Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket
notes: Includes an RH-35E Riah 35 Draken-E with two different arm configurations.

title: RX-160S Byarlant Custom
notes: Includes adapter for Action Base 1 and marking sheet with labels for HGUC-140.

title: MSN-001X Gundam Delta Kai
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-115. Transforms via parts-swapping.

title: YAMS-132 Rozen Zulu
notes: Includes clear display stands for relay INCOM hands and Psycho Jammers.

title: MSA-003 Nemo
notes: Color variant of HGUC-140; GM Rifle replaced with Beam Rifle.

title: MS-06R-1A Zaku II (Black Tri-Stars Custom)
RGM-96X Jesta Cannon
notes: Parts variant of HGUC-130.

title: MS-06R-1A Zaku II (Shin Matsunaga Custom)
notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-151.

title: RX-79(G)Ez-8 Gundam Ez8
series: Mobile Suit Gundam: The 08th MS Team
notes: Includes parachute pack. Compatible with the Weapon Rack of HGUC-079.

title: RX-0 Full Armor Unicorn Gundam (Unicorn Mode)
notes: Re-release of HGUC-101 with Full Armor parts. Includes stands for rocket boosters.

title: Type89 Base Jabber

title: AGX-04 Gerbera Tetra
notes: Includes optional Stürm Booster.

title: AMX-014 Döven Wolf (Unicorn Ver.)
notes: Includes swappable hidden arms, wires and support stands for the Beam Hands.

title: MSM-08 Zogok (Unicorn Ver.)
XXXG-01W Wing Gundam

MSA-003 Nemo (Unicorn Desert Color Ver.)

title: F91 Gundam F91

title: Harrison Madin's Gundam F91
notes: Color variant of HGUC-167.

notes: Parts and color variant of HGUC-160. Includes Gundam and GM-type faces.
